subject: Re: [junit] problem compiling and testing
msgSnippet: Eric, I hate to ask, but your code includes: TestResult tr0 = new TestResult(); TestResult tr1 = new TestResult(); suite = new ActiveTestSuite(testClas);
messageBody:
Eric,

I hate to ask, but your code includes:

TestResult tr0 = new TestResult();
TestResult tr1 = new TestResult();
suite = new ActiveTestSuite(testClas);
suite.runTest(suite.testAt(0), tr1); // X
if(tr0.wasSuccessful())

Did you mean tr0 at the line marked X?

David Saff


strohtennis wrote:
> I am attempting to make a server for a computer bowl competition that
> will test competitors source code, keep track of team results and
> return results to the competitors. The only trouble I am having is
> that I am getting strange results from my tests. As you can see I've
> set up a very simple class A1 to test my results. The ActiveTestSuite
> always returns true for both TestResults and the TestSuite returns
> false for both.
>
> Thanks,
> Eric
>
>
> public class A1
> {
>
> public A1()
> {}
>
> public int get1()
> {
> return 1;
> }
> }
>
> public class A1Test extends junit.framework.TestCase
> {
>
> public void test1()
> {
> A1 p = new A1();
>
> assertEquals(1, p.get1() );
> }
>
> public void test2()
> {
> A1 p = new A1();
>
> assertEquals(2, p.get1() );
> }
>
> }
>
> package cccb.fileTester;
> import junit.framework.*;
> import junit.extensions.*;
> import java.io.*;
>
> public class FileTester
> {
> private String studentFilename;
> public FileTester(String sFilename)
> {
> studentFilename = sFilename;
> }
> public FileTester(File f)
> {
> studentFilename = f.getName();
> }
> public boolean testFile() throws Exception
> {
> CompilingClassLoader ccl = new CompilingClassLoader();
>
> TestSuite suite;
>
> //studentFilename = "C:/StudentWork/A1.java";
> //or C:/StudentWork/A1.jar - .class file in the jar
> int len = studentFilename.length();
> String test;
> if(studentFilename.substring(len-4).equals("java"))
> test =
> "\\JunitTests\\"+studentFilename.substring(len-7,len-5)+"Test";
> else
> test =
> "\\JunitTests\\"+studentFilename.substring(len-6,len-4)+"Test";
> System.out.println("test = "+test);
> Class testClas = ccl.loadClass(test, studentFilename,true);
> if (testClas ==null)
> {
> return false;
> }
> TestResult tr0 = new TestResult();
> TestResult tr1 = new TestResult();
> suite = new ActiveTestSuite(testClas);
> suite.runTest(suite.testAt(0), tr1);
> if(tr0.wasSuccessful())
> System.out.println("test 0 was a success");
> else
> System.out.println("test 0 not successful");
>
> suite.runTest(suite.testAt(1),tr1);
> if(tr1.wasSuccessful())
> System.out.println("test 1 was a success");
> else
> System.out.println("test 1 not successful");
>
>
> suite = new TestSuite(testClas);
> suite.runTest(suite.testAt(0), tr1);
> if(tr1.wasSuccessful())
> System.out.println("test 0 was a success");
> else
> System.out.println("test 0 not successful");
>
> suite.runTest(suite.testAt(1),tr1);
> if(tr1.wasSuccessful())
> System.out.println("test 1 was a success");
> else
> System.out.println("test 1 not successful");
>
> return (tr0.wasSuccessful()&&!tr1.wasSuccessful());
>
> }
> }
>
>
> /**********Compiling Class Loader***********/
>
> package cccb.fileTester;
> import java.io.*;
> import java.net.*;
> import cccb.FTPHandler.FileInfo;
>
>
> /*
> A CompilingClassLoader compiles your Java source on-the-fly. It
> checks for nonexistent .class files, or .class files that are older
> than their corresponding source code.
> */
> public class CompilingClassLoader extends ClassLoader implements
> Serializable
> {
>
> // Spawn a process to compile the java source code file
> // specified in the 'javaFile' parameter. Return a true if
> // the compilation worked, false otherwise.
> private boolean compile( String javaFile ,String studentFile)
> throws IOException {
>
>
> Process p;
>
>
> String[]cmd={"javac","-sourcepath",".",studentFile,javaFile,"-classpath","C:/JunitTests/junit.jar"};
>
> //THIS ALSO COMPILES CORRECTLY
> String[]cmd={"javac","-classpath","C:\\StudentWork\\A1.jar",";","C:\\junit.jar","-sourcepath",".",javaFile};
>
> p=Runtime.getRuntime().exec(cmd);
>
> try {
> p.waitFor();
> } catch( InterruptedException ie ) {
> System.out.println( ie ); return false;}
>
> int ret = p.exitValue();
> return ret==0;
> }
> // The heart of the ClassLoader -- automatically compile
> // source as necessary when looking for class files
> public Class loadClass( String name, String studentDir,
> boolean resolve )
> throws ClassNotFoundException {
>
> Class clas = null;
>
> String javaFilename = name+".java";
> String classFilename = name+".class";
>
> File javaFile = new File( javaFilename );
> File classFile = new File( classFilename );
>
> if (javaFile.exists())
> {
> try
> {
> if (!compile(javaFilename, studentDir) ||
> !classFile.exists())
> {
> return null;
>
> }
> }
> catch( IOException ie )
> {
> return null;
>
> }
>
> }
>
> try
> {
> byte raw[] = (new File(classFilename
> )).getBytes();
> int len = name.length();
> name=name.substring(len-6);
> clas = defineClass(name,raw,0,raw.length);
> }
> catch( IOException ie ) {}
>
>
>
> if (resolve && clas != null)
> resolveClass( clas );
>
>
> return clas;
> }
> public byte[] getBytes(File fileName ) throws IOException
> {
>
> int len = (int)file.length();
> byte raw[] = new byte[len];
> FileInputStream inFile = new FileInputStream( file );
> int r = inFile.read( raw );
> if (r != len)
> throw new IOException( "Can't read file" );
> inFile.close();
> return raw;
> }
> }
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
